I AM RHONDA/

MY WORK /

INDOOR SKYDIVE AUSTRALIA GROUP
Indoor Skydive Australia Group provide indoor skydiving facilities to Australia, New Zealand and South East Asia regions. ISA Group uses specially constructed vertical wind tunnels to simulate the free fall experience of skydiving within a safe environment used by tourists, skydiving enthusiasts and the military.

My involvement in the ISA Group website builds for both the Australian based website (iFly Downunder) and the Malaysian based website (AirRider) was as Front End Developer primarily taking PSD designs and creating interactive web pages. This has been a ten month contract with both websites requiring a total build using modules to display packages and prices, news and events, faq along with a booking and payment system complete with voucher purchase and redeem and contact-us page.

Components used to build these websites include; Flickity for responsive carousels, Select2 for custom dropdown styling, Isotope to sort and display elements, Bootstrap Accordion for FAQs along with Font Awesome for social media icons and the inclusion of video and Google Maps.

Technical aspects of both websites also include; responsive design with image optimisation along with the use of Bootstraps; flexbox, tabs, modals, fields and forms in addition to styling third party components.

HOW /

  • / HTML5 /
  • / CSS3 /
  • / Sass /

VISIT WEBSITE /

8SECONDZ
8secondz is a mentor and competition-driven App for teenagers to share their raw talent. 8secondz allows the creation and sharing of 8-second videos according to categories of; sport, fashion, dance, art, music and science. Winners as talented up-and-coming in their field have the opportunity to be mentored by celebrity artists.

The Crooked website will require much the same technologies and approach as this personal website has taken to build. The project scaffolding will be the same using Bower to install frontend tools like Bootstrap and Font Awesome. The Sass preprocessor will be used and Gulp for task automation. The static site will be built according to the PSD design and will then be used to built a WordPress site.

This site will not be built for a customer though is expected to have functionality that will create transferrable skills for other such sites.

HOW /
  • / Bootstrap /
  • / HTML5 /
  • / CSS3 /
  • / jQuery /
  • / Sass /
  • / Gulp /
VISIT WEBSITE /

PIMP MY CAUSE
Women Hack for Non Profits is a program for women in tech to write open source software for non profit organisations. One such organisation approached WHFNP to rebuild their website a company called 'Pimp My Cause' who provide volunteers the opportunity to support good causes while developing their skills.

In my capacity as front end developer on the Pimp My Cause project I built the front page according to specification while also adapting the design for responsive behaviour. The technologies I used were Zurb Foundation framework, HTML5, CSS3, Sass and Grunt to run tasks.

I worked within a team of women to produce a total solution for the client with regular client meetings. The project was managed using JIRA and a SCRUM approach with weekly stand ups. The demands and work practices comparable to any such industry based project provided me with real world experience as a Front End Developer.

HOW /

  • / HTML5 /

VISIT WEBSITE /

MY SKILLS /

I have been involved in building websites primarily taking PSD’s and templating them into interactive web pages operating across multiple devices. I’ve worked as part of development teams to produce a number of CMS based applications and contributed towards UX/UI discussions and decisions.

I have experience building websites using CSS3, HTML5, JavaScript and jQuery. Setting up projects using Gulp, Sass and media queries for responsive design, installing Bower and Node packages for automated tasks, using Git for source management and MAMP as a web server. Building websites using the Bootstrap framework and currently learning to create custom themes in WordPress.

MEET ME /

I worked as a backend developer for many years prior to a change of career into education for a couple of years teaching at both college and university level. I have since chosen to return to industry exploring a new direction into frontend development. I enjoy the creative process of building websites and would very much like to pursue this employment interest.

I enjoy an outdoors lifestyle of exercise on the beach anything from ocean swimming, running to beach yoga. I also enjoy coastal walks, touring holidays, theatre, eating out and coffee. The rest of the time I spend in front of the computer researching or building websites like this one.
